text:p.text:span: /* * Last masq_port number in use. * Will cycle in MASQ_PORT boundaries. */

/* * free ports counters (UDP & TCP) * * Their value is _less_ or _equal_ to actual free ports: * same masq port, diff masq addr (firewall iface address) allocated * entries are accounted but their actually don't eat a more than 1 port. * * Greater values could lower MASQ_EXPIRATION setting as a way to * manage 'masq_entries resource'. * */
/* * 2 ip_masq hash tables: for input and output pkts lookups. */
/* * Hashes ip_masq by its proto,addrs,ports. * should be called with masked interrupts. * returns bool success. */
/* * UNhashes ip_masq from ip_masq_[ms]_tables. * should be called with masked interrupts. * returns bool success. */
/* * Last masq_port number in use. * Will cycle in MASQ_PORT boundaries. */

/* * free ports counters (UDP & TCP) * * Their value is _less_ or _equal_ to actual free ports: * same masq port, diff masq addr (firewall iface address) allocated * entries are accounted but their actually don't eat a more than 1 port. * * Greater values could lower MASQ_EXPIRATION setting as a way to * manage 'masq_entries resource'. * */
/* * 2 ip_masq hash tables: for input and output pkts lookups. */
/* * Hashes ip_masq by its proto,addrs,ports. * should be called with masked interrupts. * returns bool success. */
/* * UNhashes ip_masq from ip_masq_[ms]_tables. * should be called with masked interrupts. * returns bool success. */
